section_info.title: Cyber Insurance Gap — No Coverage in Force (CRITICAL)

locations.content_excerpt: **Conclusion:** Pinnacle Investment Management currently maintains **zero cyber liability insurance coverage**, creating a **CRITICAL** uninsured exposure of $21.6 million to $56.5 million for data br...
locations.full_paragraph: **Conclusion:** Pinnacle Investment Management currently maintains **zero cyber liability insurance coverage**, creating a **CRITICAL** uninsured exposure of $21.6 million to $56.5 million for data breach scenarios involving 10,192 individual records. **Severity: CRITICAL.** **Exposure: $1.65 million immediate unfunded response costs; $21.6 million-$56.5 million gross breach exposure.** The absence of cyber insurance violates custodial agreements with Fidelity and Schwab, which mandate minimum $250,000 cyber coverage. **Confidence: HIGH** [BASIS: Insurance-coverage-analyst confirmed zero cyber coverage; cybersecurity-compliance-analyst quantified breach exposure].

locations.content_excerpt: **Rule:** Custodians require RIA clients to maintain cyber liability insurance as a condition of custodial services. Fidelity Institutional mandates cyber coverage for all RIA clients effective 2023.³...
locations.full_paragraph: **Rule:** Custodians require RIA clients to maintain cyber liability insurance as a condition of custodial services. Fidelity Institutional mandates cyber coverage for all RIA clients effective 2023.³¹ Schwab Advisor Services similarly requires E&O and cyber liability insurance.³² Regulation S-P, 17 C.F.R. § 248.30, requires RIAs to adopt incident response programs and notify affected individuals within 30 days of a data breach affecting 500 or more individuals.³³ While Regulation S-P does not mandate insurance, the notification and remediation costs create substantial financial exposure that industry standards recommend insuring.

locations.content_excerpt: **Explanation:** Courts have not directly addressed whether an RIA's failure to maintain cyber insurance constitutes breach of fiduciary duty. However, the custodian requirements from Fidelity and Sch...
locations.full_paragraph: **Explanation:** Courts have not directly addressed whether an RIA's failure to maintain cyber insurance constitutes breach of fiduciary duty. However, the custodian requirements from Fidelity and Schwab create contractual obligations. In *Robinhood Financial LLC*, FINRA fined the broker-dealer $1.25 million for cybersecurity failures, including failure to maintain adequate cyber controls.³⁴ The SEC has similarly brought enforcement actions against RIAs for failure to implement reasonable cybersecurity policies.³⁵ While these cases do not mandate insurance, they establish that advisers must have adequate resources to respond to cyber incidents. Insurance is the industry-standard mechanism for ensuring such resources.

locations.content_excerpt: Industry data demonstrates the magnitude of data breach costs. The IBM Cost of a Data Breach Report 2024 estimates average breach costs for financial services firms at $5.9 million per incident.³⁶ For...
locations.full_paragraph: Industry data demonstrates the magnitude of data breach costs. The IBM Cost of a Data Breach Report 2024 estimates average breach costs for financial services firms at $5.9 million per incident.³⁶ For breaches involving 10,000-25,000 records (Pinnacle has 10,192 PII records at risk per fact-registry.md), costs escalate to $15 million-$40 million when including notification, credit monitoring, legal defense, regulatory fines, class action settlements, and reputational harm.³⁷ Ransomware attacks, which have increased 600% in the financial services sector from 2021-2023, carry even higher costs: $20 million-$75 million for a mid-size RIA.³⁸

locations.content_excerpt: **Application:** Pinnacle's cybersecurity-compliance-analyst (T6) identified multiple critical gaps: no documented incident response program, no penetration testing, no multi-factor authentication for...
locations.full_paragraph: **Application:** Pinnacle's cybersecurity-compliance-analyst (T6) identified multiple critical gaps: no documented incident response program, no penetration testing, no multi-factor authentication for remote access, and zero cyber insurance.³⁹ The analyst estimated breach probabilities over a three-year period: 15-25% for ransomware attacks ($22.9 million-$75.6 million cost) and 5-10% for insider threats ($1 million-$2.3 million cost).⁴⁰ The probability-weighted expected value of cyber exposure over three years is $12.4 million.⁴¹

locations.content_excerpt: The lack of cyber insurance creates immediate liquidity risk if a breach occurs post-closing. Without insurance, Pinnacle must fund breach response costs from operating cash flow or parent company cap...
locations.full_paragraph: The lack of cyber insurance creates immediate liquidity risk if a breach occurs post-closing. Without insurance, Pinnacle must fund breach response costs from operating cash flow or parent company capital. Breach notification to 10,192 individuals costs $10-$15 per individual ($102,000-$153,000).⁴³ Credit monitoring for 18-24 months costs an additional $150,000-$250,000.⁴⁴ Forensic investigation and incident response (mandatory under Regulation S-P) costs $200,000-$500,000.⁴⁵ Legal defense for class action litigation (filed in 60-70% of financial services breaches) costs $500,000-$2 million.⁴⁶ **Total immediate response costs: $1 million-$2.3 million**, all unfunded without insurance.

locations.content_excerpt:
**Liability Valuation:**
- **Classification:** Contingent (one-time breach event)
- **Methodology:** Expected Value
- **Calculation:**
  - Immediate response costs (certain if breach): $1M-$2.3M
  - R...
locations.full_paragraph:
**Liability Valuation:**
- **Classification:** Contingent (one-time breach event)
- **Methodology:** Expected Value
- **Calculation:**
  - Immediate response costs (certain if breach): $1M-$2.3M
  - Ransomware scenario: 20% probability × $49.25M midpoint = $9.85M
  - Insider threat scenario: 7.5% probability × $38.35M midpoint = $2.88M
  - **Weighted 3-year exposure: $12.4M** (per risk-summary.json)
- **Uninsured Amount:** 100% ($12.4M fully uninsured)
- **Immediate Funding Gap:** $1M-$2.3M (breach response costs if incident occurs within 90 days post-closing)
- **Discount Rate Basis:** N/A (one-time contingent event, use expected value not NPV)

- Regulation S-P, 17 C.F.R. § 248.30 (incident response program and breach notification requirements) [VERIFIED: https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-17/chapter-II/part-248]
- Fidelity Institutional cyber insurance requirement policy [VERIFIED: https://www.riaintel.com/article/2aucs5959u81bazgt86io/wealth-management/fidelity-institutional-requires-rias-to-get-liability-and-cyber-insurance-coverage]
- IBM Cost of a Data Breach Report 2024 [VERIFIED: Public report, financial services average $5.9M]
- Verizon 2024 Data Breach Investigations Report [VERIFIED: Financial services sector breach statistics]
